title: Republicans in Congress press for answers about unsafe conditions in Army barracks
description: A dozen GOP House lawmakers are pressing the Army's top civilian and military leaders for information about substandard conditions inside the service's barracks, which they say pose health risks to the troops and hurt the Army's recruiting and retention efforts.

title: Chinese seizure of Taiwanese fishing boat seen as part of troubling pattern
description: Chinese forces seized a Taiwanese fishing boat in the ill-defined waters off the island of Kinmen late Tuesday night and took the vessel to a Chinese port, Taiwanese news outlets reported Wednesday, the latest aggressive move short of outright combat by Beijing against the island democracy it claims as part of its sovereign territory.

title: Any port in a storm: Iconic, decrepit SS United States seeks new home after Philly eviction
description: In its day, the SS United States was a nautical marvel, the fastest passenger liner to cross the Atlantic Ocean in a record time that has stood for more than 70 years. But the only race the vessel known as "America's flagship" is competing in now is a race against time to avoid the scrapyard.

title: Italy appeals court to rule on fate of 2 Americans in 2019 death of Rome police officer
description: Two American men convicted in the slaying of an Italian plainclothes police officer during a botched sting operation faced another verdict on Wednesday in a new trial after Italy's highest court threw out their convictions.

title: EU commission approves Lufthansa purchase of long-troubled Italian airline ITA, with conditions
description: The European Commission on Wednesday approved Lufthansa's takeover of Italian airline ITA with conditions to protect competition in a deal that Italy's finance minister called "historic."

title: Settlement tracking group says Israel has made largest West Bank land seizure in 3 decades
description: Israel has approved the largest seizure of land in the occupied West Bank in over three decades, a settlement tracking group said Wednesday, a move that could further worsen already soaring tensions linked to the ongoing war in Gaza.

title: Tunisia sets elections for October. The increasingly authoritarian president hasn't said he'll run
description: Tunisia's increasingly authoritarian leader has scheduled the next presidential election for October without saying whether he will seek a second term after five tumultuous years at the head of the North African nation once seen as a model of democracy for the Arab world.

title: German police investigate video that appears to show Euro 2024 security punching and kicking a fan
description: Police in the German city of Frankfurt are investigating a video that appears to show a fan being punched and kicked while being detained by a group of Euro 2024 security personnel at Portugal's game with Slovenia.

title: Russian missiles and drones strike eastern Ukraine's Dnipro in a daylight attack that kills 5
description: A Russian missile and drone attack on the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Wednesday killed five civilians and injured 47 others, including a 14-year-old girl, authorities said.

title: The Belarus president says some seriously ill political prisoners will be released
description: President Alexander Lukashenko of Belarus announced Tuesday that he will release some seriously ill political prisoners who were jailed during protests against his authoritarian rule in 2020.

title: New Dutch leader pledges to cut immigration as the opposition vows to root out racists in cabinet
description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof gave his first speech to parliament on Wednesday, pledging that he will work hard at one of his new goverment's main aims: reducing immigration.

title: Egypt swears in a new Cabinet as mounting economic challenges fuel public discontent
description: Egypt's new Cabinet was sworn in Wednesday as the country faces an ailing economy and raging conflicts in neighboring nations.

title: Mosaics by an artist accused of abusing women will stay on the Lourdes shrine, for now
description: A French bishop has put off any decision on whether to remove mosaics by an ex-Jesuit artist accused of abusing women, saying that they'll stay for now on the Lourdes shrine but that eventually they should be removed.

title: Missing nuts and bolts caused last year's deadly construction elevator accident in Sweden
description: A construction elevator that killed five people when it collapsed last year in Stockholm was missing the bolts that were supposed to hold its mast together, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Former Northern Ireland unionist leader ordered to stand trial for alleged sex offenses
description: A judge on Wednesday ordered the former leader of Northern Ireland's biggest unionist party to stand trial on charges of rape and sexual offenses.

title: A French citizen pleads guilty to charges of collecting military data in Russia, state media say
description: A French citizen arrested in Russia has pleaded guilty to criminal charges involving illegally collecting information on military issues in the country, state news agency Tass said Wednesday.

title: Severe overcrowding, lack of exits and mud contributed to a deadly stampede in India
description: Severe overcrowding and a lack of exits contributed to a stampede at a religious festival in northern India, authorities said Wednesday, leaving at least 121 people dead as the faithful surged toward the preacher to touch him and chaos ensued.

title: At least 7 arrested in Germany and Sweden on suspicion of committing war crimes in Syria
description: At least seven people have been arrested in Germany and Sweden on suspicion of committing crimes against humanity and war crimes in Syria in 2012-2014, authorities in the two countries said Wednesday.

title: Strike kills family as Israeli evacuation order sparks panicked flight from southern Gaza city
description: The Hamdan family -- around a dozen people from three generations -- fled their home in the middle of the night after the Israeli military ordered an evacuation from the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis.

title: Taiwan says it was warned by China to not interfere in the detention of Taiwanese boat crew
description: Taiwan said Wednesday that China warned Taiwan's coast guard against interfering in the detention of a Taiwanese fishing boat, in what is seen as Beijing's latest attempt to encroach on Taiwanese territory.

title: Chris Mason: We stand on the threshold of a landmark election
description: The Tories are braced for defeat, as Labour prepares for victory but polling day could still bring surprises.

title: World's oldest cave art found showing humans and pig
description: The oldest example of cave art has been discovered on an Indonesian island and dated back 51,200 years.

title: Cavendish breaks Tour de France stage record
description: Briton Mark Cavendish claims the outright Tour de France stage win record by taking his 35th victory to surpass Eddy Merckx on stage five in Saint Vulbas.

title: Only far right can win majority, warns French PM
description: French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal urges voters to stop Marine Le Pen's party winning Sunday's vote.

title: Where has the UK's summer gone?
description: It's been a return to cooler and wetter weather following late June's spell of heat. Can we expect the return of anything warmer soon?

title: Water firms could be sued over sewage after ruling
description: Owners of adjacent waterways or even members of the public could now bring action over sewage pollution.

title: Biden blames jet lag and travel for poor debate performance
description: The president's comments come after a first Democrat in Congress called for him to withdraw from the election.

title: Captain Tom's daughter disqualified from charity
description: The family of the late fundraising veteran say they have made the "difficult decision" not to appeal.

title: Children scream in excitement after spotting humpback whale
description: The whale was spotted as the schoolchildren were returning from a trip to Sark.

title: Gazans seek shelter as Khan Younis exodus continues
description: Palestinians continue to stream out of eastern Khan Younis in response to Israeli evacuation orders.

description: Explore the manifestos of the main parties in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland and compare their policies on key issues with this interactive guide.

title: How do the parties compare?

title: Photo ID, polling stations, and postal votes: A simple guide
description: The UK general election is on Thursday, 4 July, but there are reports some postal votes have been delayed.

title: Find out who's standing in your area
description: Find out which constituency you are in, who you can vote for and where you can vote using our postcode search.

title: What photo ID will you need to vote in the general election?
description: Everyone voting in person at the general election on 4 July will have to show valid photo ID.

description: The UK general election is on Thursday, 4 July, but there are reports some postal votes have been delayed.

title: What photo ID will you need to vote?
description: Everyone voting in person at the general election on 4 July will have to show valid photo ID.

title: Hurricane Beryl: Record-breaking sign of warming world
description: Beryl is the earliest category five Atlantic hurricane on record, fuelled by exceptional sea warmth.

title: A Bugatti car, a first lady and the fake stories aimed at Americans
description: A former US police officer runs an AI-powered network of misleading news sites turning its sights towards November.

title: What we know about the India crush that killed 121
description: The incident that took place during a religious gathering is among the deadliest crushes in India in a decade.

title: What the main parties are saying about disability
description: With 16 million disabled people in the UK, what are the main political parties offering?

title: What will the election mean for North Sea oil?
description: Political parties are offering substantially different policies for the future of Scotland's oil and gas.

title: Five reasons to be positive about England
description: BBC Sport takes a look at five reasons to be positive about England's Euro 2024 chances after they reached the quarter-finals.

title: 'Why football at Euros is different to what we're used to'
description: BBC Sport columnist Nedum Onuoha explains why Euro 2024 is not bringing out the best versions of the top teams and star players.

title: Police investigate after mum admits ending life of terminally ill son
description: Police say they are looking into reports relating to "an apparent case of assisted dying" in 1981.

title: Greece starts six-day working week for some industries
description: The country says the policy will help boost economic growth.

title: Sperm donor says Netflix series is misleading
description: Jonathan Jacob Meijer is the subject of a new documentary titled The Man With 1,000 Kids.

title: Cameroon president's daughter hints at same-sex relationship
description: Homosexual acts are outlawed in the county and carry punishments of up to five years in jail.

title: Ex-Post Office chair denies hiding key Horizon report
description: Tim Parker says he did not share a report with the Post Office board following advice from lawyers.

title: Husband who put body in suitcase guilty of murder
description: Aminan Rahman choked Suma Begum before putting her into a suitcase and dumping it in a river.

title: Suspected hit-woman arrested in Armenia
description: Aimee Betro is taken into custody after being found near the country's capital, police say.

title: Cavendish breaks Tour de France stage record
description: Briton Mark Cavendish claims the outright Tour de France stage win record by taking his 35th victory to surpass Eddy Merckx on stage five in Saint Vulbas.

title: Toney 'annoyed' at lack of Euro 2024 game time
description: England striker Ivan Toney admits he was 'annoyed' at being brought on on injury time against Slovakia insists he will 'take my opportunity when I get it'.

title: Kartal's 'dream' Wimbledon run goes on
description: Britain's Sonay Kartal moves into the third round of Wimbledon with a hard-fought victory over Clara Burel in three sets.

title: Former England and Bath coach Rowell dies
description: Jack Rowell, described by his club as "a unique character who will never be equalled", dies at the age of 87.

title: Briton Kartal secures third-round Gauff meeting
description: Sonay Kartal becomes the first Briton to reach Wimbledon's third round,  producing the biggest win of her career against Clara Burel.

description: Sir Keir Starmer visits Carmarthenshire for the Labour leader's final day of campaigning.

title: Election outcomes won't change its Ukraine support, says the UN General Assembly's president
description: The president of the U.N. General Assembly says it will keep standing up for Ukraine’s territorial integrity and sovereignty whatever the outcome of national elections across the globe this year, adding that no country has the right to invade another one

title: Greece's governing center-right party evicts lawmaker after airport altercation over flight boarding
description: Greece’s governing center-right party has booted out a lawmaker and former minister who allegedly manhandled an airport worker in a failed bid to board a domestic flight he’d turned up late for

title: Turkmenistan and Iran sign deal to supply gas to Iraq. Iran will build pipeline to aid delivery
description: Turkmenistan and Iran have signed a contract for the delivery of 10 billion cubic meters a year of Turkmen gas that Iran will then ship on to Iraq

title: Italian Premier Meloni rebukes the youth wing of her far-right party for glorifying fascism
description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni has admonished the youth wing of her far-right Brothers of Italy after an Italian news outlet published videos showing some of its members glorifying fascism

title: Renowned Nazi hunter in France advises Jews to choose far right over far left in elections

title: Polish man charged in Denmark over assault on prime minister Frederiksen
description: A Polish man has been charged with assaulting Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen last month, his lawyer said

title: Roadside bomb kills former Pakistani senator, 2 others in northwest Pakistan: Police
description: Police say a former senator in Pakistan has been killed when a vehicle carrying him and supporters struck a roadside bomb in a former stronghold of the Pakistani Taliban near the Afghan border

title: Bulgarian Parliament rejects new government proposed by leader of main party
description: Bulgaria’s Parliament has voted down a minority government proposed by the center-right GERB party, which likely will bring the country closer to new elections

description: The U.N. intellectual property agency says China has requested far more patents than any other country when it comes to generative AI, with the United States a distant second

description: In a landmark decision, Japan’s Supreme Court has ordered the government to pay suitable compensation to about a dozen victims who were forcibly sterilized under a now-defunct Eugenics Protection Law that was designed to eliminate offspring of people w...

title: AP PHOTOS: Voters will deliver judgment on Conservative government in UK national election
description: Voters in the United Kingdom will cast ballots in a national election on Thursday, passing judgment on British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s 20 months in office — and the four Conservative prime ministers before him. Polls, commentators and politicians all suggest that the left-of-center opposition Labour Party has a strong lead over the Conservatives, who have been in power for 14 years.
